data.title: KKR & Co. declares $0.175 dividend
data.description:
• KKR & Co. (NYSE:KKR) declared $0.175/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous.
  • Forward yield 0.43%
  • Payable Feb. 28; for shareholders of record Feb. 14; ex-div Feb. 14.
  • Beginning with the dividend to be announced with the results of the quarter ending March 31, 2025, KKR intends to increase its regular annualized dividend per share of common stock from $0.70 to $0.74.
  • See KKR Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Comstock subsidiary approved for $152M allocation for Oklahoma qualified private activity bonds
data.description:
• Comstock (NYSE:LODE) announced that its subsidiary, Comstock Fuels, was approved by the Oklahoma State Treasurer’s Office to issue up to $152M in qualified private activity bonds.
  • This overall approval by the Oklahoma State Treasurer’s Office comes under the Oklahoma Private Activity Bond Allocation Act and would consist of allocations from the Oklahoma Economic Development Pool, the Oklahoma Exempt Facilities Pool, and the Oklahoma Carryforward Pool.
  • LODE shares rise 5.5% premarket on Tuesday.
  • Source: Press release

data.title: McKesson to take 80% interest in PRISM Vision for about $850M
data.description:
McKesson (NYSE:MCK) has agreed to acquire an 80% controlling interest in PRISM Vision Holdings, an ophthalmology and retina management services provider, from Quad-C for about $850M.

PRISM Vision physicians will continue to retain a 20% interest in PRISM Vision. The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions, including necessary regulatory clearances.

This transaction will enable McKesson to develop a leading retinal and ophthalmology platform. PRISM affiliated practices include more than 180 providers, 91 office locations and seven ambulatory surgery centers

Following completion of the transaction, PRISM Vision will be consolidated within McKesson’s U.S. Pharmaceutical segment.

Upon closing, PRISM Vision is expected to be around $0.20 to $0.30 accretive to McKesson’s adjusted earnings per diluted share in the first 12 months, and $0.65 to $0.75 accretive by the end of the third year following close.

“The acquisition of PRISM Vision will allow McKesson to build on our leadership in community practice and specialty solutions, while building a platform to serve the high-growth area of retina and ophthalmology,” said Brian Tyler, chief executive officer of McKesson.

Source: Press Release

data.title: Oaktree Specialty Lending declares $0.40 dividend
data.description:
• Oaktree Specialty Lending (NASDAQ:OCSL) declared $0.40/share quarterly dividend.
  • Forward yield 10.03%
  • The Board of Directors also declared a supplemental distribution of $0.07 per share.
  • Payable March 31; for shareholders of record March 17; ex-div March 17.
  • The company had declared of $0.55 per share quarterly cash distribution in November 2024.
  • See OCSL Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Fox Non-GAAP EPS of $0.96 beats by $0.34, revenue of $5.08B beats by $260M
data.description:
• Fox press release (NASDAQ:FOX): Q2 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.96 beats by $0.34.
  • Revenue of $5.08B (+20.1% Y/Y) beats by $260M.
  • Quarterly Adjusted EBITDA was $781 million, an increase of $431 million or 123% from the amount reported in the prior year quarter.
  • The company has declared a dividend of $0.27 per Class A and Class B share. This dividend is payable on March 26, 2025 with a record date for determining dividend entitlements of March 5, 2025.

data.title: Mesa Laboratories Non-GAAP EPS of $2.72 beats by $1.21, revenue of $62.84M beats by $4.01M
data.description:
• Mesa Laboratories press release (NASDAQ:MLAB): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $2.72 beats by $1.21.
  • Revenue of $62.84M (+17.5% Y/Y) beats by $4.01M.
  • Non-GAAP core organic revenues1 increase was 13.2%.
  • Non-GAAP adjusted operating income excluding unusual items2 increased 13.3% and was 23.5% as a percentage of revenues.
  • Total Net Leverage Ratios* as of March 31, 2024, June 30, 2024 and September 30, 2024 were 3.84x, 3.78x, and 3.59x, respectively.

data.title: Intuitive Machines to redeem outstanding warrants
data.description:
• Intuitive Machines (NASDAQ:LUNR) said on Tuesday that it has delivered a notice of redemption to redeem all of its outstanding warrants to purchase shares of the company’s Class A common stock, $0.0001 par value per share, that were issued under the Warrant Agreement, dated as of September 21, 2021, for a redemption price of $0.01 per warrant.
  • Under the terms of the Warrant Agreement, the company has the right to redeem all the outstanding warrants if the last sales price of the Class A Common Stock is at least $18 per share for any 20 trading days within any 30-day trading period ending on the third business day before the date on which a notice of redemption is given.
  • The last sales price of the Class A Common Stock has been at least $18 per share on each of 20 trading days within the 30-day trading period ending on January 30, 2025.
  • Intuitive Machines (NASDAQ:LUNR) shares were up 2.49% in pre-market trading.

data.title: DIH expands strategic partnership with Zahrawi Group
data.description:
• DIH Holding (NASDAQ:DHAI) has announced the expansion of their strategic partnership with Zahrawi Group, DIH's representative and sales partner, to include Saudi Arabia.
  • The expansion aims to enhance the distribution and accessibility of DIH's innovative rehabilitation solutions across these regions, leveraging Zahrawi Group's established presence and expertise in the healthcare sector.
  • The collaboration will focus on delivering state-of-the-art technologies to improve patient outcomes and support healthcare professionals with cutting-edge tools.
  • By combining DIH's technological expertise with Zahrawi Group's (MTC Company) regional experience, the collaboration is poised to make a meaningful impact on rehabilitation services delivery in the Middle East.
  • "Extending our partnership with DIH aligns with our mission to provide smart solutions, innovative products, and outstanding services to improve people's lives every day," said Abdulrahman Ramadan, Group CEO of Zahrawi Group.

data.title: CTS Corporation misses top-line and bottom-line estimates; initiates FY25 outlook
data.description:
• CTS Corporation press release (NYSE:CTS): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.53 misses by $0.01.
  • Revenue of $127M (+1.6% Y/Y) misses by $5.8M.
  • Adjusted EBITDA margin was 24%, compared to 22% in the fourth quarter of 2023.
  • Operating cash flow was $26 million, down from $32 million in the fourth quarter of 2023.

  • 2025 Guidance: CTS expects full-year 2025 sales to be in the range of $520-$550 million vs. $551.56M consensus and adjusted diluted EPS to be in the range of $2.20-$2.35 vs. $2.37 consensus.

data.title: Olin downgraded at RBC Capital Markets on shaky demand recovery
data.description:
Olin (NYSE:OLN) on Tuesday was downgraded to Sector Perform from a previous investment rating of Outperform by analysts at financial-services firm RBC Capital Markets. They said the chemical maker is facing a “delayed demand recovery,” though anti-dumping laws may help its epoxy-making unit.

“While we believe Olin (NYSE:OLN) has best-in-class chlor-alkali assets and strong operational leverage, near-term headwinds remain” to earnings, Arun Viswanathan, analyst at RBC, said in a February 4 report. “Anti-dumping is likely to be a benefit to Epoxy, although Chlor-alkali earnings are likely to see headwinds from tariff implementation and the potential for retaliation.”

RBC cut its price target to $30 a share from $45 a share previously, based on an estimated enterprise value that’s an unchanged 7 times earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization for 2025.
